full_text:
The #Mets said they were going to protect their top prospects and they did.  It's not the deadline I anticipated, but all in all, they did add some pieces that should help.

End of the day? Results matter.

Let's just hope whatever deals are made are smart ones.
@JJFan18 I may have not always agreed with Adam Rubin, but I always trusted his information. We're all poorer for not having Adam cover #Mets anymore.

@kwiatkowski_bob Hey Bob, breaking news, the Wilpons own SNY and still retain 5% percent ownership of #Mets‚Ä¶ And if you think that passive aggressive Jeff wouldn‚Äôt love to see Steve Cohen‚Äôs team fail squirm you‚Äôre just not paying attention.

@jjburkeesq @DSmithTruther I would, and have.

are willing to deal Josh Hader to #Mets for a fair price. https://t.co/eGwRoyDCig

#help https://t.co/NweHmIB3cf
@ChrisTh38804748 @CryingFlores @realnyteams Classic Wilpon fear of media and fan base

@caribeanpirate @dallasrpi I'm not creating a false equivalency. It's a hopeful comparison. Stick was effective because he stood up to George, and had a few years to make the soup while Big Stein was on ice
@ChrisTh38804748 @CryingFlores @realnyteams I always do.
@MattyHarris20 @Metstradamus There is some truth in that; but there are plenty of #Mets folks on SNY who do a great job.
@DSmithTruther I've always said that Sandy's #Mets tenure is a mix of good and bad, just like Steve Phillips.
@paul_viruet @astoriacub7 That's a non-starter, #Mets would never do that.

@ChrisTh38804748 @realnyteams FWIW, I've always thought Alderson's perception of what a manager should be gets in the way of his being widely accepted. That, and his dry sarcasm which goes over a lot of folks' heads. 

Sandy's #Mets tenure, IMO, is about the same as Steve Phillips. A mix of good and bad.

@DSmithTruther Sorry, I don't agree. I have fairly criticized Alderson as much as anyone, but he was given as big a mess as New York baseball has ever seen and helped get the Mets to a World Series in 2015 despite the Wilpons. 

Results matter.
@realnyteams I don't believe he's as involved as much as some think. This isn't a Charles Wang/Mike Milbury type deal
@paul_viruet I worry about stuff like that after the season. They are not trading deGrom.
@chalulu23 Well, not every one. Just from one writer. There are many great people who work at SNY whose work I value.
@paul_viruet I honestly believe that #Nats are refusing to trade him to #Mets.
@caribeanpirate @dallasrpi Some messes are too hard to clean up. Throw in a dopey owner who spends big bucks for names, but not for organizational infrastructure, and you have the Angels.

The point I am trying to make re: #Mets is that being afraid of media / fan blowback was always a Wilpon thing, not a #Mets thing.  

Being conservative was always an Alderson thing, and he resisted trading for Cespedes until the Gomez deal fell apart. But he still made deal.
@Tobycooklyn I'm trying not to get too excited about a possible Wilmer reunion, because that would be incredible.
@MetsFanMM Hang in there man. I went back to work right away after my mom passed and I was not ready. Pace yourself. Praying for you.
@BillSte91243664 Depends on the prospect and depends on the rental. #Mets have a real chance to win a World Series here, and a few key pieces could really make a difference.

@dallasrpi IMO, good organizations know which of their prospects are pretenders or contenders. 

Gene Michael put on a clinic during his #Yankees tenure, and he served as a mentor to Eppler.

@chriszav It's hard to determine which rumors have real teeth and which ones are gamesmanship ploys to drive up the price. Teams with assets always try to up the ante.

I do know that Eppler & Co. are working hard to improve the team. I also know this is not a time to stand pat.

#Mets wanting to hold onto its best prospects and not overpaying for a rental is way different than being gun shy about making a deal that could backfire. The latter is SNY clickbait, which I refuse to link to, but if that story doesn't sound like a Jeff Wilpon take, I'm nuts.

@GaryMagnifico Well, Gary, I'd say @PSLToFlushing was right in his assessment of Diaz. Joe looked deeper than Diaz's surface struggles when many of us just thought he was shaken by NY.

@Tobycooklyn A leak is when someone gives you an unsolicited tip or piece of info; working with a source is a different process. Sources are developed over years, you can find out things without relying on leaks, which are usually clickbait.
